This state of mind preyed upon my health
which had entirely recovered from the
first shock it had sustained. I shunned
the face of man; all sound of joy or
complacency was torture to me; Solitude
was my only consolation deep, dark,
death-like solitude. My father observed
with pain the alteration perceptible in my dispositions & habits,
and endeavoured to reason
with me on the folly of giving way to immo
derate grief. "Do you think, Victor" said he
"That I do not suffer also– no one ^could love
a child more than I loved your brother–
